summary: This bill, the Treatment, Recovery, Education, Awareness, and Training for Youth Act (TREAT Youth Act), aims to amend the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act. Specifically, it focuses on reauthorizing a youth prevention and recovery initiative. The bill outlines authorized appropriations for this initiative, specifying funding levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2030, with amounts increasing annually. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on June 3, 2025, and referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce and the Committee on Education and the Workforce.
